p: Due to the anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties of selenium, some research has focused on its role in skin cancer prevention. Whether selenium can prevent skin cancer or not is controversial. Research by Pols et al. indicates that a high serum concentration of selenium is associated with an approximately 60% decrease in the incidence of basal cell carcinoma (BCC) and squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) of the skin [ 94]. However, some researchers have demonstrated that supplementation with Se does not significantly affect the incidence of BCC or is ineffective in preventing it [ 95, 96].
